results.title: La Traviata
results.creator_credit: Accent Films, Radiotelevisione Italiana, Tarak Ben Ammar and Franco Zeffirelli
results.brief_description: This is Zeffirelli’s lavish production of Verdi’s much-loved opera, “La Traviata”, starring Teresa Stratas and Placido Domingo. Violetta Valery is giving a party to celebrate her return to society after an illness - here she meets Alfredo, son of a wealthy merchant, and they fall in love. They live happily together until Alfredo’s father comes to Violetta and asks her to end the affair in order to spare his family further dishonour. The heartbreak destroys Violetta’s health completely, and Alfredo realises what Violetta has sacrificed - but it is too late!
results.creator_credit_for_label: Accent Films, Radiotelevisione Italiana, Tarak Ben Ammar and Franco Zeffirelli

results.title: La Traversee de Paris = Four Bags Full
results.brief_description:
A wealthy artist and a simple cab driver join up to transport four suitcases of blackmarket pork across Paris during the Occupation, dodging German roadblocks, hungry dogs and collaborators. Awards: Venice Film Festival 1956: Best Actor for Bourvil.

Credits: Producer, Yves Laplanche ; director, Claude Autant-Lara ; writers, Jean Aurenche, Pierre Bost ; photography, Jacques Natteau ; music, Rene Cloerec ; art direction, Max Douy.
Cast: Jean Gabin, Bourvil, Louis de Funes, Janette Batti, Robert Arnoux, Georgette Anys, Anouk Ferjac, Bernard Lajarrigue.

results.title: La Trace = the Trail
results.brief_description:
Joseph is a young Savoyard peasant who makes a living by crossing the Alps into Italy in the winter months selling his wares to the villagers. This story traces a winter’s itinerary as the man encounters various adventures in his always dangerous journey, but he remains oblivious to all the nuances and reverberations of social change going on around him. When he finally returns to his family after many months away, he discovers to his surprise that his village is now a part of France and it looks like a Savoyard would soon be sitting on the throne of a unified Italy. The film was originally shot in wide screen format. This copy is presented in standard screen ratio 3:4.

Credits: Producer, Claude Nedjar ; director, Bernard Favre ; writers, Bernard Favre, Bertrand Tavernier ; photography, Jean-Francis Gondre ; music, Marc Perrone, Nicola Piovani.
Cast: Richard Berry, Berangere Bonvoisin, Sophie Chemineau, Marc Perrone, Robin Renucci.

results.title: La Tete Contre les Murs = the Keepers
results.brief_description:
Francois Gerane is convinced his father, a famous lawyer, has killed his mother. Using as a pretext one of Francois’s small misdeed, Maitre Gerane has the rebellious young man committed to a mental home. Much of Franju’s first feature was shot in an actual asylum. The film is essentially a plea for a more sensible treatment of the mentally ill and the emotionally distressed, calling for much-needed widespread reforms. ‘La tete contre les murs’ is surely the most beautiful French film made since the war, and possibly the most beautiful French film ever made.” Reference: POSITIF, 1/7/1959.

Credits: Producer, Jerome Goulven ; director, Georges Franju ; writers, Jean-Charles Pichon, Jean-Pierre Mocky ; photography, Eugene Schuftan ; music, Maurice Jarre ; assistant director, Jacques Rouffio ; camera assistant, Claude Zidi.
Cast: Jean-Pierre Mocky, Anouk Aimee, Pierre Brasseur, Charles Aznavour, Paul Meurisse, Jean Galland, Edith Scob, Jean Ozenne.

results.title: La Sylphide
results.brief_description: La Sylphide, in diaphanous white costume and with shining wings, dances for the Scottish farmer James, in the first scene of this most famous and enduring ballet by August Bournonville. This production by the Royal Dutch Ballet was partly recorded in the atmosphere of live performance but essentially in the confines of an empty Royal Theatre. The orchestra is conducted by Paul Jorgensen.

results.title: La Spagnola
results.creator_credit: Australian Film Commission, SBS Independent, Wild Strawberries, Anna-Maria Monticelli and Steve Jacobs
results.brief_description: Directed by Steve Jacobs and set in 1960, “La Spagnola” is one family’s story of the migrant experience in Australia. Lola (Lola Marceli) is a beautiful, tempestuous Spanish woman living in a remote industrial town with her boorish husband, Ricardo (Simon Palomares), and their teenage daughter, Lucia (Alice Ansara). When Ricardo decides to leave her for his Australian mistress, Lola is left destitute and pregnant turns violent and vengeful. Her daughter, sensitive, lonely, mocked at school, and confused by her mother’s anger toward her, seeks refuge in an aunt and tries to reconcile with her absent father. Lola is driven by a quest for revenge against the two who have robbed her of her only security in a strange land. Lola and Lucia, each striking out hatefully at the other, are on a collision course, plotting their separate plans for vengeance. Also starring Alex Dimitriades as a local playboy, romantically interested in both mother and daughter. Mostly in Spanish, with Italian and English, and with English subtitles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian Film Commission, SBS Independent, Wild Strawberries, Anna-Maria Monticelli and Steve Jacobs

results.title: La solitude du chanteur de fond = The Loneliness of the Long Distance Singer
results.brief_description:
In 1974, Chirs Marker followed singer Yves Montand as he was preparing a benefit concert for the Chilean refugees. Without any commentary, but with virtuoso editing and many insightful close-ups, Chris Marker sketches a warm portrait of the singer. He analyses Montand’s political engagement, his tension before the show and his relationship with his pianist, Bob Castella.

Credits: Director, Chris Marker ; photography, Pierre Lhomme, Yann Le Masson.
Cast: Yves Montand.

results.title: La Sentence = the Sentence
results.brief_description:
In September 1944, four resistance fighters and a fisherman are captured by German soldiers after a failed grenade attack. They are taken to the basement of a deserted house while awaiting their fate. They are to be executed in the morning.

Credits: Producer, Christine Gouze-Renal ; director, Jean Valere ; writers, Georges-Jan Arnaud, Marcel Moussy, Jean Valere ; photography, Henri Decae ; music, Daniel Lesur ; art direction, Bernard Evein, Jacques Saulnier.
Cast: Robert Hossein, Marina Vlady, Roger Hanin, Beatrice Bretty, Lucien Raimbourg.

results.title: La Sel de la terre
results.creator_credit: Intermondia Films, V. Blavier and Georges Rouquier
results.brief_description: Lyrical impression of the Camargue county at the mouth of the Rhone - long, flat reaches of salt impregnated land, rich in bird and animal life. The latter sequences deal with the draining of the land its fertilization and bringing it into production. Sparse commentary in French.

results.title: La scalo lo scalone
results.brief_description: A child born to Italian parents in country Victoria learns about his growing sexuality. In innocence he and his friends play the usual child games of Doctors and Nurses as a natural means of learning. His play is fettered by religious guilt (that he’s yet to understand) and further complicated my his mother’s sudden death. A story about the loss of innocence - both as a state of mind and a time in one’s life that will never be the same again.
